record.title: ORDER OF PROCEDURE

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Republicans control the time until 4 p.m., the Democrats control the next 30 minutes, the Republicans control the following 30 minutes, and the Senate continue to alternate control of 30 minute blocks of time thereafter.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Now, Mr. President, I understand Senator Domenici wishes also to say a few words. As far as I am concerned----

Mr. President, I was hoping our leader would be here because he wanted some of this 15 minutes and I was thinking I could get in on part of it and I would not be here all afternoon. I do not have a long speech.
I say to the Senator, I understand he might.
Yes. Mr. President, I intend to use the first Democratic block of 30 minutes.
But if Senator Domenici wishes to speak in the first Republican 15 minutes, and if he goes over for a certain amount of time, I am perfectly happy to yield to him. He is a very distinguished Senator.

Mr. President, I say to the Senator, thank you so much. I am going to proceed on our time and see what happens with our leader. If he arrives, I will, obviously, yield to him. I will sit down and quickly get out of the way.

record.chair: The Senator from New Mexico is recognized.
